See?

This is ridiculous.

You know, after playing around with it for a bit, I can't really see the use in one of these. I mean, sure, it's a blast to put something into ridiculous suborbital trajectories, but I have to burn retrograde to put any vehicle I... "Drive" into a useable orbit. Sometimes, no matter how nice the approach, the craft veers off to the south and never goes above 46km altitude. That's not counting the absolutely insane loss of attitude control that takes a minute and a half to salvage without using time-warp. Sure, it's gorgeous to look at, was well modeled, and it was a nice shoutout to Ace Combat, but it's impractical, and frankly, the New Lunar Republic Space Program doesn't have a place for it.

I don't mean to sound like a bastard, sorry... It really is very pretty...

Also, I'm currently working on making it click-to-launch instead of just proximity based; this should allow me to include the "launch from here" feature.

I don't mean their eccentric nature, I mean that an eastward facing launch is somehow putting me into a polar (sub)orbit... the eccentricity I understand, but how is it getting this incredible inclination from an equatorial eastward launch?
It shouldn't do that, but sometimes it does. I'm still trying to work out why myself.

The Idea behind using mass drivers is to limit the amount of fuel actually needed onboard your spacecraft. So I would think that the mass driver, once the new version is complete would give you enough speed to make it into a decent orbit, right now the mass driver is a little crazy at times, I remember people posting pics of flinging rovers out to the mun's orbit.......

This is an awesome concept and im glad someone is using it in KSP. I thought you may have gotten your inspiration from this device http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/StarTram a real life version. I didn't know they featured the concept anywhere other than sci-fi books. I once read a sci-fi book where this concept was how they commercialized spaceflight, the launcher actually reached all the way around the Earths equator in order to use the Earths rotation as a speed boost and kind of fling the space craft into space.

Keep up the good work, awesome mod idea, I hope you are able to get it to work the way you want and have it be a little more balanced with the game. Unless you don't care about balance, it's your mod, shoot for the stars.

IMO it should have some sort of disadvantage, otherwise there would be no point in using anything else. In real life the disadvantage is the cost of building it, the quality of materials needed, the ruggedness of the spacecraft being launched due to the g-forces involved, and the cost of powering it, oh, and maintenance would be a bitch. Maybe make it only fire-able once per day, or week, its basically recharging and resetting during these times, or make the weight limit kinda small, like 10 tonnes or so max. Just a couple thoughts to keep in mind.

I have not used Deadly Reentry. But g-forces always peak over 10g during launch, so I doubt it would work without also having FAR and putting things in fairings.

It's pretty much impossible to use with Deadly Reentry. The craft reaches superheating speed in an instant and fries immediately.
